file_content.text: We mourn a loss. You have our thanks--for answers and for vengeance.
I located the remains of your recon team. There was no Talz among them, but I did find the combat sensor logs.
There is no Talz? But... we see him die in his final transmission. He is our only son.
I didn't realize. I'm sorry.
There is no time to grieve. Our son wants the mission completed.
Analyze the combat logs.
Analyze the combat logs.
There is work to do. We are finding retribution against the enemy who kills our son.
You both knew the risks.
If it is your child dying, you are not so indifferent to the pain.
The combat logs require time to analyze. Patience....
These readings do not make sense. Wampas, whitefangs, skels--all working together. Attacking as one. Something leads them. The sensors do not identify it.
Then we keep looking.
This is beyond our ability to help you--but there are others, close by.
So what does all that mean?
Hoth's predators are natural enemies--but here they kill together, like an army. Something unknown leads them. That is our true foe.
Another useless dead end.
Before, there is a hidden enemy. Now, we know its shape and means of attack. This is progress.
The sensor logs show the beast's leader moves toward the Jagged Plains. Republic forces are there. You must warn them.
There is a group of Jedi at the outpost. They are useful allies. Show them the sensor logs.
Okay. Get yourself indoors.
We remain on watch. If the enemy appears, we will not hesitate to strike.
But what about you?
We mourn our son in private. There are songs to sing, words to recite. They are not for your ears.
I'll deal with this my way.
The Jedi pursue our mutual quarry. They know more than they tell us. Perhaps they tell you more.
Go to the Republic outpost on Jagged Plains. Find the Jedi. Make my son's murderer pay.
You retrieve the combat sensor logs. They contain the answers we seek.
You are General Nadab's team. We greet you as fellow Republic warriors.
You are General Nadab's recruit? This is no fight for lone warriors.
We are Captain Armaruk, recon team leader. We fear we send you to a quick death, like all our teammates.
I'm sorry for your loss.
All who are seeking the hidden enemy hope not to find it. That path ends in death.
Why say "we"? You're alone.
We are Talz, and all Talz are one. Talz remind ourselves of this always. Our language is not your concern.
They were bad at their jobs.
We lead the best recon team on Hoth. We find Imperial bases and White Maw hideouts. Now, we find death.
We receive a distress call from our team, minutes ago. The enemy that butchers without mercy attacks them.
The last survivor is a brave Talz. He transmits a final message and speaks of a "living shadow." There is nothing more.
It's a clue we can follow.
We plan for every outcome. We know the team's death is possible. They do not die in vain.
There's no way to save him?
Scout team's death is fate. Brave Talz's death is past. There is no changing these things.
We're off to a lousy start.
You understand our fear for your safety. This enemy kills all that it finds.
There is still hope of victory--revenge for the fallen. Our team carries advanced combat sensors. They are always recording.
Combat sensor logs contain readouts, scans, data. Analysis reveals our enemy's face. You retrieve the combat sensor logs from the ambush site.
Yes. I'll get the sensor logs.
This seems like a long shot.
The combat sensor logs are our best hope--to know the hidden enemy, find it and kill it.
Enough weird talk. Just point.
Hurry. Go to these coordinates, recover the combat sensor logs and return them to us. Hopefully, you do not die.
We monitor a mission. Do not interrupt us.
